explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: It was a kind of tributyl tins, and since tributyl tins were once used as antifouling agents for hulls or fishing implements, it was considered not to ignite spontaneously even if it contacted the normal temperature air. Thus it was defined as "out of Category".

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid (melting point <= 140degC) substances are not available.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: It was a kind of tributyl tins, and since tributyl tins was once used as a antifouling agent of a hull or fishing implements, it was considered to be stable to water and carried out the outside of category.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Category 3 based on SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LD50; VALUE: 50-100 mg/kg (ACGIH 7th, 2001) and 99 mg/kg (Patty, 5th, 2001; RTECS, 2004)

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: From the knowledge that the skin is stimulated and a burn injury is caused (HSFS, 1999), and that tributyltin compounds or organic tin compounds indicate skin irritation (DFGOT 1, 1991-atty 5th, 2001; ATSDR, 2005), it was judged that it had slight skin irritation leastways, and was set as category 3.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: From knowledge that an eye is stimulated and a burn is caused (HSFS, 1999), and eye irritation is indicated with the organic tin compound (ACGIH 7th, 2001; Patty 5th, 2001; ATSDR, 2005), it is set as Category 2A-2B. In addition, detailed categorization is difficult.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible

carcinogenicity.rationale: The organotin compounds is classified into A4 (it cannot classify into a the human carcinogens) in ACGIH. On the other hand, there is also a knowledge that a certain kind of organotin compounds induces cancer to animals (ATSDR, 2005) and data of its this product themselves cannot be found. Therefore, it cannot be classified since the data is insufficient.

toxic_to_reproduction.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the undorn child
toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Since embryo fetus fatality and the developmental abnormality (the craniofacial and skeletal muscle system) were seen in the teratogenicity study using rat in the dose which indicates maternal toxicity (ATSDR, 2005; RTECS, 2004), it was set as Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (central nervous system); Category 2 (digestive system); Category 3 (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs (central nervous system); May cause damage to organs (digestive system); May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Since in the guidance value of Category 2, gastrointestinal bleedings was observed in the mouse (ATSDR, 2005), and the influence of the central nervous system on human (ATSDR, 2005; ACGIH 7th, 2001; Patty 5th, 2001) and the potential of respiratory irritant (ATSDR, 2005; ACGIH 7th, 2001) as an organic tin compounds are descrived, it was considered as Category 1 (central nervous system), Category 2 (alimentary system), and Category 3 (respiratory irritant).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (immune system) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Although own data of this product could not be found, since the impacts of effects on the human immune system was suggested by as an organic tin compounds (ATSDR, 2005;ACGIH 7th, 2001-atty 5th, 2001), it was classified into Category 1 (immune systems).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48-hour LC50=3.3microg TBT/L (tributyltin acetate concentration equivalent: 4.0microg/L) of Crustacea (Daphnia magna) (EHC15, 1980).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity is Category 1,not rapidly degrading (it hydrolyzed, and tributyltin hydroxides was generated, and remained (existing chemical substances safety inspections data)), and bioaccumulative (BCF=9210 of tributyltin hydroxides (existing chemical substances safety inspections data)).
